Top-3 Similar Questions: au_63724: How do I start Firefox in another language than the default?
au_822097: startx not starting applications in fullscreen
au_204103: Firefox 16 won't start from the gnome shell in 12.10
Top-3 Scripts:
au_63724: LC_ALL=en_GB firefox -no-remote

sudo locale-gen fr_FR fr_FR.UTF-8 && echo "Success"
sudo apt-get install firefox-locale-fr
LC_ALL=fr_FR firefox -no-remote

Explanations about Options.-d:
Specify the debugger in which to start firefox. The default is gdb. Used in
 conjunction with -g.
Explanations about Options.-no-remote:
Don't connect to any other running instances of firefox. Use this if you want to
 run firefox in an entirely new process. By default, firefox will delegate a command
 to an already running instance.
